intro: Manniophyton chevalieri, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its erect, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
